qas.question: In what year was Union Street constructed?
Who performed at the New Palace Theatre in the 1930s?
How many pubs existed on Union Street in the 1930s?
What group famously enjoyed themselves on Union Street?

context: Built in <a0_0>1815<a0_0/>, Union Street was at the heart of Plymouth's historical culture. It became known as the servicemen's playground, as it was where <a3_0>sailors from the Royal Navy<a3_0/> would seek entertainment of all kinds. During the 19<a2_0>30s<a2_0/>, there were 30 pubs and it attracted such performers as <a1_0>Charlie Chaplin<a1_0/> to the New Palace Theatre. It is now the late-night hub of Plymouth's entertainment strip, but has a reputation for trouble at closing hours.
